programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind S17
programme.desc: Clive Myrie asks the questions in the celebrity version of the classic quiz where celebrities donate to charity. Eastenders actor Ricky Groves, comedian Harriet Kemsley, Made in Chelsea star Verity Bowditch and writer Bonnie Greer go under the spotlight answering questions on James Bond themes, sloths, Sir David Attenborough and Hattie McDaniel.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt and chefs Jack Croft, Will Murray and Saliha Mahmood Ahmed are joined by special guest Greg James. There are great moments from the BBC food archive, including clips from Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd, and drinks expert Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes.

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking (Family Bakes) S1 (4/6)
programme.desc: «Family Bakes»Nadiya shares some family favourites, from the ultimate flapjacks to an epic cookie pie.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and her guests look ahead to what promises to be a crucial weekend of fixtures in the Premier League as the season enters its penultimate month. Kicking things off is the lunchtime clash between Manchester City and Liverpool, the last two teams to lift the league title. Other games include Arsenal v Leeds, while tomorrow's meeting between Newcastle and Manchester United is a repeat of the EFL Cup final, which gave Erik ten Hag his first silverware since taking charge of the Red Devils.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Christina Trevanion are in the heart of Shropshire for today's Bargain Hunt from the antiques and collectors fair at Oswestry Showground. The reds and blues do battle with the help of antiques experts Kate Bliss and Ochuko Ojiri. Which team will make the most profit at auction? Christina visits one of the most historically important buildings in Britain, a flax mill in Shrewsbury which can lay claim to being the world's first skyscraper.

programme.title: Garden Rescue S3
programme.desc: The team create two gardens for small children in London and Shrewsbury.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S22 (10/10)
programme.desc: Briony May Williams helps a couple swap their narrowboat for a more traditional house.

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad with all the results, reports and reaction from the afternoon's big games.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind S17
programme.desc: Clive Myrie puts four more famous faces under the spotlight in another episode of the classic quiz where celebrities donate to charity. Journalist John Pienaar, lead singer of Britpop band Shed Seven, Rick Witter, comedian Suzi Ruffell and actor Dakota Blue Richards are in the famous black chair tonight answering questions on Clement Attlee, The Smiths, the films of Sandra Bullock and the music of Lana Del Rey.

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies S2
programme.desc: Ross Kemp presents the high stakes quiz, where a team of celebrity radio presenters - Tony Blackburn, BBC Radio 1's Katie Thistleton, YolanDa Brown from Jazz FM and Heart FM's Lauren Layfield - take on the Bridge of Lies for their chosen charities.

programme.title: Blankety Blank S1
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Adjoa Andoh, Martine McCutcheon, Johnny Vegas, Jimmy Carr, Chizzy Akudolu and Joe Swash try to fill in the missing blanks and help the contestants win some famous prizes.

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities S15
programme.desc: A celebrity special edition of the general knowledge quiz in which four teams try to come up with the answers that no-one else could think of. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and co-host Richard Osman, with contestants Tomasz Schafernaker, Owain Wyn Evans, Kerry Godliman, Toussaint Douglass, Nicki Chapman, Kelli Young, Jeremy Edwards and Lucy Dixon.

programme.title: Casualty (Baby, I Don't Care) S37 (n°25)
programme.desc: «Baby, I Don't Care»An unexpected arrival in the ED forces Faith to confront her darkest secret.

programme.title: Comptine mortelle S1 (1/6)
programme.desc: The editor of a top crime writer is drawn into her own mystery when he is found dead.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights of Saturday's Premier League games, with title contenders Arsenal and Manchester City in action. Arsenal hosted Leeds, while back-to-back champions Manchester City were at home to Liverpool, the team they took the title off two years ago. Other games included Chelsea v Aston Villa and Fulham's trip to relegation-threatened Bournemouth.

programme.title: Legends of Welsh Sport (Gareth Bale)
programme.desc: «Gareth Bale»The inside story of one of football's most talented players, Gareth Bale.

programme.title: Pundits
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards rank the best football pundits.
